modules.description: List of Terraform modules present in the configuration.

root_path.description: The Terraform root directory of the project.

module_path.description: Path to the current module. For remote modules, this is the path relative to the module's code directory.

blocks.description: List of blocks (e.g., resource, data, variable) within the module.

kind.description: Kind of the block (e.g., resource, data, module).

type.description: Type of the block (e.g., aws_s3_bucket for a resource). For blocks that can only have 1 label (such as module or variable) this attribute will be empty.

name.description: Name of the block defined by the user.

attributes.description: Key-value attributes associated with the block.

known.description: Indicates whether the value of the attribute is known during analysis.

value.description: The actual value of the attribute. If unknown, then null. Can be a primitive, object, or array.

filepath.description: Path to the source file where the object is defined relative to the module's file system.

startline.description: Line number where the object starts in the source file.

endline.description: Line number where the object ends in the source file.

managed.description: Indicates whether the object is controlled by this source. Not relevant for Terraform.

explicit.description: True if the object is explicitly defined by the user.

unresolvable.description: True if the value cannot be determined statically.

fskey.description: Internal filesystem key for uniquely identifying the object.

resource.description: Fully qualified resource name if applicable. E.g. aws_s3_bucket.test[0]
